sources.title: Morgiana (1972)
sources.description: Morgiana is a 1972 Czechoslovak Gothic drama film directed by Juraj Herz, based on a novel by Alexander Grin, Jessie and Morgiana. The film  explores themes of jealousy, betrayal, and the dark side of familial relationships as it follows  two sisters, Klara and Viktoria, whose relationship deteriorates after their father's death. Viktoria, jealous of Klara's inheritance and her romantic involvement with a man she loves, plots to murder her sister using a slow-acting poison.

metadata.Plot: Klara and Viktoria are sisters. Their father dies, leaving most of his property to Klara. When Klara becomes involved with a man that her sister loves, Viktoria begins to plot her murder.
metadata.Writer: Vladimír Bor, Alexander Grin, Juraj Herz
metadata.Actors: Iva Janzurová, Josef Abrhám, Nina Divísková
